title: Change Key Modifier Prioritization?
body:
(Only tested with Lulu E "Help, Pix!")
I notice in games when I try to self cast spells using Alt+key, the spell tends to prioritize what I'm hovering over rather than myself.  After playing Lulu for 4 years, this is the first time I noticed such a prioritization.  I've lost quite a few fights due to me shielding a minion/ enemy when I Alt+e.

Is there any way to change this?

replies.body:
Abilities will always cast on an ally if you have them selected, regardless of using a self-cast keystroke. This is how the system is designed, so going forward, I recommend not selecting an ally if you intend on self-casting an ability. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

What do you mean by selected?  Do you mean just hovering over an  ally, or click selecting them?

Anyways, my main issue is not with allies, but casting on minions/ enemies when I self cast.
Can you test this by loading into a custom and see if self-cast works if you don't hover over enemies/allies/minions with your mouse?
Yes, it works fine when nothing is around.  Otherwise it prioritizes anything under my mouse... ally minions, enemy minions, ally champions, enemy champions.

Interesting. After some thorough testing, I found the behavior you're experiencing only happened when I changed to 'Quick self-cast'. If this is the type of casting you're using, I recommend switching over to regular self-cast where this may not happen.

Let me know.
Thank you so much for taking the time to look into it!!  I always thought 'Quick self-cast' would be... well... quick.  Makes my life so much easier now.
